titles.title: Juab County Surface and Ground Water Study and Development Act of 2007
Juab County Surface and Ground Water Study and Development Act of 2007
A bill to amend the Reclamation Projects Authorization and Adjustment Act of 1992 to provide for the conjunctive use of surface and ground water in Juab County, Utah.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Bingaman without amendment. With written report No. 110-115.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 248.

action.text: Indefinitely postponed by Senate by Unanimous Consent.

term.name: Federal aid to water resources development

bill.summary: 6/28/2007--Reported to Senate without amendment. Juab County Surface and Ground Water Study and Development Act of 2007 - Amends the Reclamation Projects Authorization and Adjustment Act of 1992 to include Juab County among those Utah counties for which Bonneville Unit of the Central Utah Project funds may be provided for a Utah Division of Water Resources feasibility study and development of systems to allow groundwater recharge, management, and the conjunctive use of surface water resources with groundwater resources.
